body_html:
I solved this problem by using a CNTLM proxy and setting http_proxy and https_proxy like http://127.0.0.1:3128.

One strange thing is that bazel issued a warning saying that it ignores http_proxy while in fact not.

If you also experience certificate errors, find your cacerts file and insert the required certificate extracted using a browser or a similar tool.

body:
I solved this problem by using a CNTLM proxy and setting `http_proxy` and `https_proxy` like `http://127.0.0.1:3128`.

One strange thing is that `bazel` issued a warning saying that it ignores `http_proxy` while in fact not.

If you also experience certificate errors, find your `cacerts` file and insert the required certificate extracted using a browser or a similar tool.
